info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 7:07PM CDT by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
info.description:
At 706 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain producing thunderstorms from Malden to DePue to Spring Valley, including over I-80, that were nearly stationary.
HAZARD...Minor flooding and winds in excess of 40 mph.
HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Princeton, Hennepin, Spring Valley, DePue, Granville, Ladd, Dalzell, Mark, Cherry, Malden, Seatonville, Standard, Dover, Hollowayville, Coal Hollow, Zearing, and Ottville.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 59 and 72. Interstate 180 between mile markers 8 and 13.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforcement.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed.
